meanings.definition: To exchange things with one another
meanings.sent1: She interchanges her books with her friends to read different stories.
meanings.sent2: The students often interchange their lunch items during break time.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully interchange their toys to try out new ones.
meanings.sent4: In the game, players can interchange their cards to strategize better.
meanings.sent5: The birds interchange their feathers during molting season.

meanings.definition: A place where roads or railways cross and drivers can change from one to another
meanings.sent1: The busy interchange connects multiple highways for smooth traffic flow.
meanings.sent2: Drivers use the interchange to switch between different routes easily.
meanings.sent3: The interchange at rush hour can be chaotic with cars moving in all directions.
meanings.sent4: The railway interchange allows trains to switch tracks efficiently.
meanings.sent5: The city invested in a new interchange to reduce congestion on the roads.
